New Records: Phil Salt scored the fastest half-century of the tournament
Key Match Events: England beat West Indies by eight wickets with 15 balls to spare
WICKET! Moeen c Charles b Russell 13 (England 84-2)
WICKET! Russell c Salt b Rashid 1 (West Indies 143-4)
WICKET! Pooran c Buttler b Archer 36 (West Indies 141-3)
WICKET! Powell c Wood b Livingstone 36 (West Indies 137-2)
WICKET! Charles c Brook b Moeen 38 (West Indies 94-1)
Pre-Game Insights: England win the toss and will bowl!
Buttler calls correctly on what looks like a steamy St Lucia night
Rovman Powell says he’d have bowled too but ‘it looks a very good pitch’
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell: ‘I think we left 15-20 runs out there as a batting group but we could give a better display as a bowling group too’
Jos Buttler: ‘I thought it was a really good performance from us, we executed really well with the bat and ball’
Phil Salt: ‘Not looking too far ahead at the minute, just looking at a good team win’
Miscellaneous Highlights: A couple of changes for West Indies, as Roston Chase and Romario Shepherd return
Liam Livingstone has recovered from his stomach upset. One change with Mark Wood replacing Chris Jordan
Others: The crowd is building and everything feels ripe for a belter and who knows, maybe the first centurion of the tournament
The anthems ring out. A strong wind ripples the England shirts for God Save the Queen before a rousing version of Rally Round the West Indies

The ground is filled with a terrific steel band panning out hits from David Rudder and Nadia Batson outside the stadium, and then pulsing party soca - Shazam fodder territory for the names - being blared out inside
